results.description:
Though we often regard love and compassion as limited qualities, of which we hardly have enough to extend to ourselves and our families, these states can be developed and expanded with practice and effort. In fact, each of us has a boundless capacity for kindness and understanding, which we can apply to all of our relationships -- to ourselves, our family and friends, people we don’t know, and even those we don’t like. 

Creating a Compassionate World is a six-week class which combines western psychological techniques with traditional lovingkindness meditation to develop our limitless capacity for beneficial and wise action.


No pre-registration is needed.  Chairs will be provided. Note we are located on the second floor of a walk-up building.  There is no elevator.


Details and registration: http://theidproject.org/events/2016/01/06/creating-compassionate-world-nyc-online
results.name: Learn Lovingkindness Meditation - Paid Event

results.description:
What does a vision board do for you and how does it help you get you closer to your desired manifestations?

A vision board is a tool used to help clarify, concentrate and maintain focus on a specific life goal. It can be for one goal or a number of goals. Literally, a vision board is any sort of board (or box) on which you display images, quotes or sayings that represent whatever you want to be, do or have in your life.

Lets put together what we want for 2016!

Materials

Please bring the following materials with you: poster board, or small box, glue sticks, tape and scissors. (Please note that LOA Meetup will be not be supplying any of the suggested materials).

In addition, please bring your own magazines, newspapers, flyers, brochures, articles, or anything that will provide you with images, phrases, quotes and words that resonate positively with you and make you feel good. Choose items that bring vitality, sensuality, pleasure, success, achievement and excitement to your spirit.

$5.00 per person.

In case of inclement weather, an email will by sent to members by 5pm if a cancellation occurs.
results.name: YOUR VISION BOARD for 2016!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

PS: the small gym is located on the 5th floor, go through the big gym to the back.

results.name: Discovery Class

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

venue.name: Central Park: NE corner of Columbus Circle by the big statue!

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex
results.how_to_find_us: SW corner of Central Park on the west side of the large stature (Not the Columbus Statue in the middle of the circle) Cross streets: NE corner of Central Park West and 59th St.
results.name: Wednesday Runs in Central Park

WOMEN ONLY EVENT. Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene. 

Start the new year off by meeting your new BFF - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/dates/Jan-06-2016_at_0730PM

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to parties, clubs, bars, and everything else a single women doesn't want to hit "solo." 

Meet up to 30 other fabulous women (30s & 40s) at our upscale speed networking event. Also, enjoy $4 beer and $5 wine drink specials. 

We'll start you off in groups where you'll get to meet 3-4 women at a time and then we'll transition to a less formal mixer where you all can mingle at your leisure. 

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

This is a casual in-store wine tasting event, usually on the 1st Wednesday of every month, featuring a selection of 3 wines and light refreshments.

Join the Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club at The Artisan Collective for wine sipping and socializing in a fun and unpretentious environment. Each month we will taste and discuss three new wines. This event is a great way to develop your wine tasting skills, learn about different wines and meet other wine enthusiasts!

Admission: $10

Directions: NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station or Broad Street Station.

From Newark Penn Station: Take the Light Rail to NJ PAC/Center Street and walk approximately 2 blocks West to the corner of Central & Halsey Street (cross Broad Street). Turn left onto Halsey and walk to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park. Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street. Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)
results.name: Wed Night Crokinole!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

results.description:
Goals are important for creating positive changes, and the beginning of the year is a great time as it gives you an extra boost of energy to get started.

The problem is that resolutions usually focus on a symptom disguised as a problem. It's not the weight. Or being single. Or a lack of money. Or procrastination.
These are only signs that there is something behind the scenes interfering with your best interest.

Join me for a complimentary call to help you step into 2016 with your best foot forward!

I will guide you to:

•  Discover what needs your immediate attention.

•  Find what is specifically getting in the way of change.

•  Start taking steps to get on track for making 2016 happier and more fulfilling!


Sign up here.  You will receive email instructions on how to connect to the call.

results.description:
This will be the last Island Labs meeting before HRU. (Ham Radio University)


http://hamradiouniversity.org/


We're not giving any talks there this year but I'll be standing at the front of the room for the WiFi Mesh talk, in support of John Wilson. (of Nassau ARES)

We might pull out the old slide deck from when we did last year's Mesh talk.

It would be good to go over the equation for predicting signal strength at a given range. (and therefore the range of a wifi setup)

At the last meeting,  Jim setup his 18-core parallella and ssh'ed into it for the first time. and... there was a "Raspberry Pi" fight. (wrestling for control of an unsecured Pi)

Conversation included:

James' Arduino display is I2C (not RS-232) leaving some "room for improvement" re: being used as an arduino's serial monitor.

Making an Embossing Seal (for marking official documents)

Aluminum foundries: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lSoWxG30rb0

induction levitation furnaces: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q6Zrnv4OtbU

Human Powered Ornithopters: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmzEKRSlA2k

Why do (Why would) galaxies take the form of a spiral? (also addressed by tech-net that Sunday)
What happens when galaxies collide? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MjRJeaNtxN4

How eliptical are the planet's orbits? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equation_of_time


Thickness of earth's crust

Harnessing the energy of Earth's rotation.
Natural coal fires (currently thousands, representing 3% of the worlds CO2 emissions?)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session: Nov 11, 2015-Jan 06, 2016
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:
November 25
December 23
December 30

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/PersonifyEBusiness/Default.aspx?TabID=416&pid=634127394


Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Hello Comedy Cravers!

My name is Rich and I have decided to start up the group again. I joined a while ago but I guess there was never a real attempt to get it going.

I figure it would be best to get the party rolling right away.  I have planned a comedy show meet up for next Wednesday December 2.  The location is OAK Barrel Restaurant in West Orange.  It is a great venue with a full food menu, a bar, and is handicapped accessible.

The show will start at 8:30 and will feature Johnny Watson, who has appeared on Saturday Night Live and performed for the troops.

Please arrive around 8:00pm to grab a seat, mingle and make new friends.  This should be a blast!

I hope to see everyone there!

-Rich

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.how_to_find_us: American Sign Language School - 225 West 23rd Street
results.name: Basketball Open Play- ASL Wednesday A-B

results.description:
Hey let's get together this Wednesday to have some great laughs with some of NYC's best comedians. We always have a good hang before and after the show. QED has a great beer & wine selection and on this night, some pretty heavy hitters in the comedy scene. First of all, Duo standup is when two comics perform stand-up comedy together. The show is a combination of regular standup, two person improv and those old 2 person sketches of the vaudeville days.

Headlining the January Duo Show are Joe List (Comedy Central Half Hour) and Mark Normand (Conan). Joe and Mark have a podcast called Tuesdays with Stories.

Also Featuring:
Amber Nelson (Comedy Central/Montreal Just for Laughs) and a Mystery Partner)
Tim Dillon (Gotham live) and Ray Kump (Funny or Die)
Jonathan Mcbride (Don't Grow up Comedy Show) and May Wilkerson (Cake or Death)
Ian Hunt and Matt Leary (Good for You at the Cantina Royal)
And also your Producers: FreddyG (Sirius) and Patrick Holbert (Cake or Death)

Hosted by: FreddyG

Lineups subject to change.

Come at 8:30 if you can! Get a good seat, have a drink, and get to know some other Astorians!
results.name: Hump Day Laughs!!  *Duo Comedy Show*

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
